intro: Ajax breviflos, commonly known as the short-flowered ajax, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or white in color. Ajax breviflos thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant collections.
